page.title: 14LOCAL WORDS
page.content: {ACKERSPIKE} (to sprout) The tree had a funny ackerspike on it's side. {BACKERTS}(backwards) That boy is backerts. {BRUMMOCK}(short axe) My dad chops wood with a brummock. {FANG}(take hold of) Don't fang me like that it hurts. {FIRK}(to poke around) I had to firk the key into the hole. {GAUP} (stare) Don't gaup at me when I'm eating my dinner. {PATHER}(treading) Stop pathering on my clean floor. {SQUITCH }(couch grass)There is some squitch growing in the garden. {BOG }(clump of flowers) There is a bog of flowers in the garden. {SWILKER}(splash) Don't swilker you are getting me wet.
